entry.title: In One Minute : WordPress
entry.summary: WordPress is a PHP-based, open source content management system (cms) for creating websites and blogs. Through its dynamic presentation of content, webmasters have the flexibility to create beautiful and useful websites easily. Through its system of filters and hooks, WordPress allows developers to extend functionality through pieces of code called functions, which can be grouped into separate executables called "plugins". It is also possible to customize a WordPress installation via the creation of custom themes. b2 was the precursor of WordPress and developed in 2001. It used PHP and MySQL but was not so successful (only 3000 blogs until 2003). WordPress appeared the first time in 2003 as a fork of b2, version 1.0 was in development until January 2004. WordPress has since been improved m‚Ä¶

entry.title: Matplotlib - Visualization with Python
entry.summary:
Introduction
Matplotlib is the ‚Äúgrandfather‚Äù library of data visualization with Python. John Hunter created it. He created it to try to replicate MatLab‚Äôs (another programming language) plotting capabilities in Python. So if you are familiar with MatLab, matplotlib will feel natural to you. It is an excellent 2D and 3D graphics library for generating scientific figures.
Matplotlib allows you to create reproducible figures programmatically. Let‚Äôs learn how to use it! Before continuing this lecture, I encourage you just to explore the official Matplotlib web page: http://matplotlib.org/ To install matplotlib on your system, you have to run this code on your command line: >> pip install matplotlib
To use matplotlib in our code, first, we have to import it. We will Import the matplotlib.p‚Ä¶

Mount Bromo Indonesia
entry.summary: 1. Teletubbies Hill You can also enjoy a very extraordinary natural state. Also this tourist spot is very suitable to be used as an object for pre-wedding photos. 2. Mentigen Hill 3. Madakaripura Waterfall 4. Bromo Milky Way 5. Penanjakan Point 1 The height of this climb 1 is at 2770m above sea level. So at this altitude it is very suitable to see the sunrise plus the background of three very beautiful mountains. 6. Whispering Sand 7. Savannah 8. Pura Luhur Poten Rainbow Coban Waterfall Finally, there is an interesting destination when there is a beam of sunlight that refracts because of the water, namely the Coban Pelangi waterfall. From the name, we certainly already know how beautiful this tour is, with the refraction of light in a luxurious and attractive waterfall, a small rainbow is born that is very pleasing to the eye. The natural state of this tour is still fairly natural because of the many wild plants that still grow around the beautiful waterfall. You are suitable to come here during the day when the eye of the heart is above your head, because it will emit light and refract optimally, in the afternoon the refraction of the light will begin to fade. That's an interesting tourist spot and is in a very beautiful location of Mount Bromo. Try all these tourist destinations and feel the sensation that you will feel. entry.title: Building Immersive Communities in public - What do you want to see next?
entry.summary:
I've taken into account some of the feedback I got recently and gave Immersive Communities a facelift. From now on, I'll start adding new features based on what the public wants to see next. :) Feel free to let me know what would you like to see next and what feature would convince you to start using Immersive Communities to build your own community? Things I've done last week on https://immersive.community You can now access the articles from the homepage.
Increased the font size of the article title, so its easier to read.
Added a preview of the article text under the title so the readers will get a gist of what the article is about without needing to click on it.
Community banner replaced with a small logo and a title.

entry.title: Most Common Word
entry.summary:
Given a string paragraph and a string array of the banned words banned, return the most frequent word that is not banned. It is guaranteed there is at least one word that is not banned, and that the answer is unique. The words in paragraph are case-insensitive and the answer should be returned in lowercase.
import re
class Solution: def mostCommonWord(self, paragraph: str, banned: List[str]) -> str: #List words in paragraph, replacing punctuation with ' ' and all lower case paragraph = re.subn("[.,!?;']", ' ', paragraph.lower())[0].split(' ')
#Remove any '' or words in banned from paragraph list paragraph = list(filter(lambda x: x not in banned + [''], paragraph))
#Return most common word in filtered list return Counter(paragraph).most_common(1)[0][0]

entry.title: How Twitter Shows Those Link Cards
entry.summary: How does the story begin? Why and what is metadata? Google crawler iterates over the web pages and fetches the website information such as title, description, images, and tags to give accurate search results to the user. Understand the logic in the simplest way, if google can easily read all the pages on your website and their corresponding data easily better it can recommend and give it to the users. How Twitter created the validation cards Metadata consists of website basic information such as title, banner image, description, tags, and so on. Using this information Twitter generates those cool cards in a fraction of seconds. Although twitter uses its own meta tags so if not provided twitter will be able to show the cards of your website. This single concept consumes a lot of my time, so‚Ä¶

entry.title: A Complete Guide to NFTs
entry.summary:
What are NFTs?
Non-fungible tokens (NFTs) are cryptographic assets on a blockchain that can be distinguished from one another by their distinctive identifying codes and metadata. A digital asset known as an NFT is a representation of a real-world item, such as artwork, music, in-game items, or films. They are regularly purchased and traded online in exchange for other cryptocurrencies, and they are typically encoded using the same software as many other cryptocurrencies. The same kind of programming that is used to develop cryptocurrencies is typically used to create NFTs. These cryptographic assets are built on blockchain technology, to put it simply. They cannot be traded or exchanged in the same manner as other cryptographic assets. NFT stands for a non-fungible token, which means tha‚Ä¶

entry.title: Migrate from render to Supabase
entry.summary:
I used PostgreSQL from render.com and I paid $7 per month for Starter plan. So, I migrate from render to Supabase. Execute pg_dump in redner's DB pg_dump --clean --if-exists --quote-all-identifiers \
Import dump files into Supabase's DB psql -h $SUPABASE_HOST -U postgres -f redner_dump.sql
Change the Web Application's DB URI to that of Supabase

entry.title: How to Make Weather App in React
entry.summary: In this article, we are going to make a weather app in react. In this project, we will use openweather API which provides us free API to get weather details. Here we will add an input field where user will add any city name and as soon city name gets entered an API call will occur and details will be fetched to the screen. This App will be completely depends on API. So basically this is going to be a beginner-friendly project, so let's make this project step-by-step. Basic knowledge of ReactJS. Basic knowledge of React hooks. Good knowledge of React Components. Now before jumping into the code, let's get the API and Key which we will use for this project. entry.summary:
git log¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§ÊòØ Git ‰∏≠‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂæàÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÊü•ÁúãÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÔºåÂÆÉ‰πüÊòØ‰∫∫‰ª¨ÂñúÊ¨¢‰ΩøÁî® Git ÁöÑÂéüÂõ†‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇ
git log¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§ËÉΩÂ§üËÆ©‰Ω†‰∫ÜËß£Âà∞Êõ¥Â§öÂÖ≥‰∫éË¥°ÁåÆËÄÖ¬†Êèê‰∫§commit¬†ÁöÑËÆ∞ÂΩï„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî®¬†git log¬†ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÁßçÊñπÂºèÊòØÊåâÊó•ÊúüÊü•ÁúãÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩï „ÄÇË¶ÅÊü•ÁúãÂú®ÊåáÂÆöÊó•ÊúüÊàñÊó•ÊúüËåÉÂõ¥ÂÜÖÂàõÂª∫ÁöÑ Git Â≠òÂÇ®Â∫ì‰∏≠ÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåËØ∑‰ΩøÁî®Â∏¶ÊúâÈÄâÈ°π¬†--since¬†Êàñ¬†--until¬†ÊàñËÄÖÂêåÊó∂‰ΩøÁî®‰ª•‰∏ä‰∏§‰∏™ÈÄâÈ°πÁöÑ¬†git log¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§„ÄÇ
È¶ñÂÖàÔºåËøõÂÖ•‰Ω†Ë¶ÅÊü•ÁúãÁöÑÂàÜÊîØÔºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåmain¬†ÂàÜÊîØÔºâÔºö
$ git checkout main
Êé•‰∏ãÊù•Ôºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåÊù•ÊòæÁ§∫ÂΩìÂâçÊó•ÊúüÔºàÂç≥‰ªäÂ§©ÔºâÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºö
$ git log --oneline --since="yesterday"
‰ªÖÊòæÁ§∫Êüê‰∏ÄÁâπÂÆöÁî®Êà∑Ôºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÁî®Êà∑¬†AgilÔºâÂú®‰ªäÂ§©ÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºö
$ git log --oneline --since="yesterday" --author="Agil"
ËøòÂèØ‰ª•ÊòæÁ§∫Âú®Êüê‰∏ÄÊó•ÊúüËåÉÂõ¥ÂÜÖÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩï„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî®‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåÊòæÁ§∫Âú®‰ªªÊÑè‰∏§‰∏™Êó•Êúü‰πãÈó¥Ôºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºå2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 22 Êó•Ëá≥ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 24 Êó•ÔºâÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºö
$ git log --oneline --since="2022-04-22" --until="2022-04-24"
Âú®‰∏äÈù¢Ëøô‰∏™‰æãÂ≠ê‰∏≠Ôºå‰ºöËæìÂá∫ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 22 Êó•Ëá≥ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 24 Êó•ÊúüÈó¥Ôºå‰∏çÂåÖÊã¨ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 22 Êó•ÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩï„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÂåÖÊã¨ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 22 Êó•ÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåËØ∑Â∞ÜÂëΩ‰ª§‰∏≠ÁöÑ¬†2022-04-22¬†ÊõøÊç¢‰∏∫¬†2022-04-21„ÄÇ
ËøêË°å‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåËÉΩÂ§üÊòæÁ§∫Êüê‰∏ÄÁâπÂÆöÁî®Êà∑Ôºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÁî®Êà∑¬†AgilÔºâÂú®‰∏§‰∏™ÊåáÂÆöÁöÑÊó•Êúü‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºö

Git ÊúâÂæàÂ§ö‰ºòÁÇπÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠‰∏Ä‰∏™‰ºòÁÇπÂ∞±ÊòØ Git ËÆ©‰Ω†ËÉΩÂ§üÊî∂ÈõÜ‰Ω†È°πÁõÆÁöÑÁõ∏ÂÖ≥Êï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇgit log¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÊü•ÁúãÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑Ôºå‰πüÊòØ‰∫∫‰ª¨ÂñúÊ¨¢‰ΩøÁî® Git ÁöÑÂéüÂõ†‰πã‰∏ÄÔºÅ

‰ΩÜÂç∏ËΩΩÂêéËøòÊúâÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇSnap Âú®Á≥ªÁªü‰∏≠‰øùÁïô‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∫õÊÆãÁïôÊñá‰ª∂Ôºå‰∏ÄËà¨Áî®Êà∑‰∏çÁü•ÈÅì„ÄÇ
ÊâÄ‰ª•ÊàëÊâìÂºÄ‰∫Ü Snap Êñá‰ª∂Â§π¬†/var/lib/snapd/snapsÔºåÂèëÁé∞ Snap ‰øùÁïô‰∫Ü‰ª•ÂâçÂÆâË£Ö/Âç∏ËΩΩÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÁöÑÊóßÁâàÊú¨„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÊòØÂØπ‰∫éÊúçÂä°Âô®ÂíåÂÖ∂‰ªñÊÉÖÂÜµÔºåËøôÂæàÂÆπÊòìÈÅáÂà∞ÊàêÊú¨ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÂÆÉ‰ºöÊ∂àËÄó‰Ω†ÁöÑÁ£ÅÁõòÁ©∫Èó¥„ÄÇ
‰ΩÜÊòØÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ËΩªÊùæ‰øÆÊîπËÆ°Êï∞„ÄÇËØ•ÂÄºÂèØ‰ª•Âú® 2 Âà∞ 20 ‰πãÈó¥„ÄÇ

Âú® SuperUser ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÁØáÊñáÁ´†‰∏≠ÔºåCanonical ÁöÑÂâçÂ∑•Á®ãÁªèÁêÜ Popey¬†Êèê‰æõ‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑËÑöÊú¨ÔºåÂÆÉÂèØ‰ª•Ê∏ÖÁêÜÊóßÁâàÊú¨ÁöÑ Snaps Âπ∂‰øùÁïôÊúÄÊñ∞ÁâàÊú¨„ÄÇ

entry.title: Jack Dorsey takes responsibility for Elon Musk‚Äôs mass layoffs at Twitter
entry.summary:
Laura Normand / The Verge
Jack Dorsey, Twitter‚Äôs co-founder and former CEO, responded to the mass layoffs under Elon Musk‚Äôs ownership by saying he owns ‚Äúthe responsibility for why everyone is in this situation‚Äù and that he grew the company ‚Äútoo quickly.‚Äù On Friday, Musk laid off about half of Twitter‚Äôs workforce, affecting employees across all departments. ‚ÄúFolks at Twitter past and present are strong and resilient. They will always find a way no matter how difficult the moment,‚Äù Dorsey writes. ‚ÄúI realize many are angry with me. I own the responsibility for why everyone is in this situation: I grew the company size too quickly. I apologize for that.‚Äù
I am grateful for, and love, everyone who has ever worked on Twitter. I don't expect that to be mutual in this...

Twitter‚Äôs app on iOS has been updated to support Elon Musk‚Äôs $7.99 per month Twitter Blue. The app‚Äôs latest update on the Apple App Store says you have to pay for Blue to get verified on the platform ‚Äújust like the celebrities, companies, and politicians you already follow.‚Äù The new Twitter Blue subscription isn‚Äôt available just yet, though. Esther Crawford, a product manager at Twitter confirmed it‚Äôs not live right now but says some users ‚Äúmay see us making updates because we are testing and pushing changes in real-time.‚Äù

Image: Apple
Apple‚Äôs building an advertising network as part of its deal to start streaming Major League Soccer (MLS) games next year, according to a report from Bloomberg. Sources familiar with the situation told the outlet that Apple‚Äôs in talks with advertisers and MLS sponsors to display ads during soccer games and ‚Äúrelated shows.‚Äù Apple struck a 10-year deal with the MLS in June and will start streaming soccer games through its Apple TV app in February 2023. While the company plans on introducing a separate, Sunday Ticket-like subscription dedicated to streaming every MLS game, it says it‚Äôll make a ‚Äúbroad selection‚Äù of MLS and Leagues Cup matches available to Apple TV Plus subscribers, with a ‚Äúlimited number‚Äù available for free. The best deal on the best earbuds is a hard combo to beat. | Photo by Chris Welch / The Verge
There‚Äôs no telling what another day might bring ‚Äî especially if you too are glued to our coverage of a certain social media hellscape ‚Äî but you can rest assured that The Verge‚Äôs deals team is always on the lookout for ways to help you save, both in the form of early Black Friday deals or whatever we can scrounge up for you on a random Saturday. And we‚Äôve got some bangers for you this week because Sony‚Äôs WF-1000XM4 earbuds are on sale for an all-time low of around $178 at Amazon and Target until tomorrow. That‚Äôs around $100 off their regular price of $278, and much better than the typical $30 discount we see. entry.title: Fix scanned images with ImageMagick
entry.summary:
Fix scanned images with ImageMagick Seth Kenlon Sat, 11/05/2022 - 03:00
Years ago while rummaging through the contents of a shelf in a used bookstore, I happened upon a booklet titled "UNIX System Command Summary for Berkeley 4.2 & 4.3 BSD," published by¬†Specialized Systems Consultants. I bought it as a curiosity item because it was nearly 20 years old yet still largely applicable to modern Linux and BSD. That amused me then and now. A booklet written in 1986 was still largely relevant in 2016, while books on the same shelf about a proprietary OS weren't worth the paper they were printed on. (Think about it: What technology do¬†you¬†think is going to survive a zombie apocalypse?) I've had the booklet on my own bookshelf for several years now, but it occurred to me that it's pro‚Ä¶

entry.title: Kuiq ‚Äî Ship your API in 10 seconds
entry.summary:
Kuiq - the way you ship your API in 10 sec ‚ö°
Why did I make Kuiq? I am looking to complete the product as quickly as possible, especially for MVP stuff. And I'm sure you all have the same opinion üòó
When deploying APIs, whether Firebase or AWS, I think you need to create a project and configure it in advance. When you are making an MVP for a product, this kind of hassle is very disturbing :/
Kuiq eliminates all of this hassle and allows you to deploy your API as soon as you log in to Kuiq üòÅ
Is this the same as Deno Deploy? Almost same. But different pricing model.
Future of Kuiq ‚úçÔ∏è Create a VSCode extension so code can be sent directly from VSCode to Kuiq
ü§ñ API with Database concept (not sure yet) When we do backend processing with API, we often want to manipulate the database. For example, storing customer email data. So I thought that having a database connected to an API that can be easily deployed might speed up the development of the product :)
Looking forward to your thought! Try it out over here üëâ https://kuiq.io/ ‚Äù

entry.title: Google Analytics Pack for Coda ‚Äî Bring your website‚Äôs data to your Coda doc
entry.summary:
@packwhale) and I‚Äôm thrilled to launch today on Product Hunt!!! About me: I‚Äôve been working in online marketing for nearly a decade and I‚Äôve always been curious about new tools that can make my life as a marketer easier.
I‚Äôve often seen people stare at their Google Analytics dashboard without really doing something actionable or meaningful to understand what‚Äôs going on with their data.
So I created the Google Analytics Pack for Coda to analyze my data, generate notes, and facilitate discussions with my team so we improve our website‚Äôs performance. You can even set up automations when you hit milestones‚Äîlike Slacking your team when web traffic hits 1M views. Here‚Äôs a glimpse of what you can do:
‚úÖ Use cases: * Build and share custom reports for your team and stakeholders. * Invite your team to analyze your website‚Äôs performance together. * Make data-based decisions, plan your marketing campaigns, and build custom automations for your data.
Special thanks to the @coda_hq team for their support üôå ‚Äù

entry.title: How to iterate over tables in Lua
entry.summary:
How to iterate over tables in Lua Seth Kenlon Fri, 11/04/2022 - 03:00
In the Lua programming language, an array is called a table. A table is used in Lua to store data. If you're storing a lot of data in a structured way, it's useful to know your options for retrieving that data when you need it.

entry.title: Is Lua worth learning?
entry.summary:
Is Lua worth learning? Seth Kenlon Thu, 11/03/2022 - 03:00
Lua is a scripting language used for procedural programming, functional programming, and even object-oriented programming. It uses a C-like syntax, but is dynamically typed, features automatic memory management and garbage collection, and runs by interpreting bytecode with a register-based virtual machine. This makes it a great language for beginners, but also a powerful tool for experienced programmers. Lua has been somewhat eclipsed from the public view by languages like Python and JavaScript, but Lua has several advantages that make it popular in some major software projects. Lua is easily embedded within other languages, meaning that you can include Lua files in the code base of something written in (for instance)‚Ä¶

entry.title: How open source weaves connections between countries
entry.summary:
How open source weaves connections between countries Phil Shapiro Thu, 11/03/2022 - 03:00
Long ago, when I was a tech administrator for Arlington Public Schools, I received an unexpected email saying, "Our school in India loves your children's stories, so we've printed them all out in braille." Apparently, the school had found my collection of children's stories on the web. I spent a moment visualizing those students so far away, enjoying my stories on those printed pages of braille. The email's sender might not have realized how meaningful their email was to me, but it's stayed with me for two decades. Tell collaborative stories with open source That experience got me thinking about how technology can weave new connections between people in different countries. While surfing‚Ä¶

entry.title: Achieve smart home interoperability with open source technology
entry.summary:
Achieve smart home interoperability with open source technology Florian Robert Wed, 11/02/2022 - 03:00
Advertisers sell the myth of the "Smart Home" as a magical world where you automate everything with ease to simplify your life and free your mind of trivial tasks. It looks great on paper and TV, but so far, it's mainly been a battle of technologies and manufacturers. Suppose you want to add a presence sensor from manufacturer A to your existing hub from manufacturer B so you can switch ON your light from manufacturer B. Or perhaps you want to switch OFF your air conditioner when your door is open, but the door sensor is not from the air conditioning manufacturer. Will it work? There's a significant chance that the devices you want to link to one another don't talk the same ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Get started with Parseable, an open source log storage and observability platform
entry.summary:
Get started with Parseable, an open source log storage and observability platform Nitish Tiwari Tue, 11/01/2022 - 03:00
Log data is one of the fastest-growing segments across data storage. It's also one of the most complicated spaces. There are several products and solutions with overlapping use cases and confusing marketing. This article looks at Parseable, a log storage and observability platform. Parseable is geared towards a better user experience, with an easy-to-deploy and use interface and a simple, cloud-native architecture. I'll also show how to set up Parseable with FluentBit to store logs.
More on Microservices Microservices cheat sheet How to explain microservices to your CEO Free eBook: Microservices vs. service-oriented architecture Free online course: Developi‚Ä¶

entry.title: Transfer files and folders from Windows to Linux with WinSCP
entry.summary:
Transfer files and folders from Windows to Linux with WinSCP Paul Tue, 11/01/2022 - 03:00
Sometimes you need to transfer files over a network. There are lots of file sharing services out there, but most require that you send your file to the Internet. This seems like a long way to go (not to mention the privacy concerns) when two computers are right beside each other, or at least in the same building. The open source WinSCP utility makes it quick and easy to transfer a file or a folder of files over the network from your Windows computer to your Linux computer.

entry.title: 20 technology horror stories about learning the hard way
entry.summary:
20 technology horror stories about learning the hard way AmyJune Hineline Mon, 10/31/2022 - 03:00
Halloween will be here before you know it! This fun, over-the-top holiday is a great time to ponder the mortal fears of the developer in each of us. What haunts you the most, in the quiet moments just before your code starts to run? Getting into the spirit of Halloween, I asked some Opensource.com writers: What's the scariest code you've seen or written?
More for sysadmins Enable Sysadmin blog The Automated Enterprise: A guide to managing IT with automation eBook: Ansible automation for Sysadmins Tales from the field: A system administrator's guide to IT automation eBook: A guide to Kubernetes for SREs and sysadmins Latest sysadmin articles Bad permissions I was responsible for ‚Ä¶

entry.title: 10 universal steps for open source code review
entry.summary:
10 universal steps for open source code review Martin Kopec Mon, 10/31/2022 - 03:00
Have you ever found yourself in a situation where you needed to do a code review but didn't fully understand the project? Maybe you did not review it to avoid looking like you didn't know what you were doing. This article assures you that there's a better way. You don't need to know everything to provide a code review. In fact, based on my experience, that's quite common. I remember when I joined Red Hat as an intern and was asked to help with code reviews. We used a system of +1 or -1 votes, and I was initially very hesitant to weigh in. I found myself asking whether when I gave a +1 on a change but then someone else voted -1, would I look foolish? What does happen if someone votes -1 on a ch‚Ä¶

entry.title: Set up a Matrix to Discord bot
entry.summary:
Set up a Matrix to Discord bot Seth Kenlon Sat, 10/29/2022 - 03:00
Matrix is a popular open source chat application that makes it easy to chat securely with people all over the world. Similarly, Discord is a non-open source chat application that's also popular with many online communities. Discord, like Matrix, provides a chat client for all major platforms both mobile and desktop, so it's perfectly usable on Linux. However, it's not open source and so, given the choice, you might prefer to use Matrix. The good news is that when not given a choice for any reason, you can also use Matrix to interface with Discord by running a Matrix-to-Discord bridge. This article shows you how to set up and run a Python Matrix bot to bridge chat between a Matrix room and a Discord channel. Re‚Ä¶
